attributes.action: Cancel any plans the Government may have on road tolls
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Although a petition was signed by more than a one point eight million people recently, it would appear that  the Government are still hellbent on now trying to push through a patchwork  system which means that no matter where you live, you will have to pay to drive your vehicle on any road.  Whether it is £1.34 a mile for inner London or 2p a mile for country road users, with every car being fitted with a tracking device, this is an infringement on people's privacy - not to mention the cost.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
